intro: Boucerosia frerei, commonly known as the Cape goldfluff, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fluffy seed heads that aid in wind pollination. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and minimal water.
